trans-unit.source: An abstract class that describes a gradient, composed of gradient stops.
Classes that inherit from <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush"></xref> describe different ways of interpreting gradient stops.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush> is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object and therefore can be frozen to improve performance.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> used to specify the location and color of the transition points in a gradient.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorInterpolationMode"></xref> enumeration that specifies how the gradient's colors are interpolated.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
Specifies how the colors in a gradient are interpolated.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorInterpolationMode.SRgbLinearInterpolation"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush.ColorInterpolationMode"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the brush's gradient stops.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A collection of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> objects associated with the brush, each of which specifies a color and an offset along the brush's gradient axis.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush.GradientStops"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode"></xref> enumeration that specifies whether the gradient brush's positioning coordinates are absolute or relative to the output area.
A value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.Absolute> indicates the gradient brush's coordinates are expressed using device independent pixels.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode"></xref> value that specifies how the gradient brush's positioning coordinates are interpreted.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush.MappingMode"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the type of spread method that specifies how to draw a gradient that starts or ends inside the bounds of the object to be painted.
The following illustration shows the available spread methods and their effect on <xref:System.Windows.Media.LinearGradientBrush> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush>.
The red line indicates the gradient space.

A <xref:System.Windows.Media.LinearGradientBrush> defines its gradient space with its <xref:System.Windows.Media.LinearGradientBrush.StartPoint%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.LinearGradientBrush.EndPoint%2A> properties.

A <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush> defines its gradient space with its <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.Center%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.RadiusX%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.RadialGradientBrush.RadiusY%2A> properties.
![Different GradientSpread settings](~/add/media/img-mmgraphics-gradientspread.png "Different GradientSpread settings")
Gradient spread methods
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The type of spread method used to paint the gradient.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientSpreadMethod.Pad"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush.SpreadMethod"></xref> dependency property.
